channel.title: Highscores help

item.title: Highscores help
item.dc:creator: @snow_blitz snow blitz
item.description:
@snow_blitz wrote:

Hello guys, i’ve followed this tut: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,364364.msg2765837.html

I’ve changed the local host in all files to my website: legaypro.org and i upload the files to legaypro.org everything works fine… look: legacypro.org/highscores/highscores.php

Only thing is when i change the ‘Localhost’ server-sided i get big errors and won’t let me connect, whys this?

Heres my code in sql.java:

try { Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance(); con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://LOCALHOST/highscores","root","111213"); stmt = con.createStatement(); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
This is what my code looks like when i put my website details in:

try { Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver").newInstance(); con = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:mysql://legacypro.org/highscores","legac125_hiscore","----"); stmt = con.createStatement(); } catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
Note: The password isn’t ---- just privacy

Instead of it being LocalHost i want it to be my website, how could i do this?

Read full topic
